intro: Ixia recurva, commonly known as the recurved ixia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bloom period occurs during the spring, producing vibrant yellow to orange flowers. Ixia recurva is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
